_header: A sour apple when it is hot

RylandsLat394.Transcription:
A sowre appul whan it is hooteShytes out alle þat he
                    woote
RylandsLat394.Note:
Trans. ‘Omne quod est in se calidum pomum cacat acre /
                        Commitando locum non mutant poma saporem’, which
                    follows.
RylandsLat394.Editions:
Pantin,  William A. 
             “A Medieval Collection of Latin and English Proverbs…from Rylands
                Latin MS. 394.” 
             Bulletin of the John Rylands Library
         14 (1930): 81-114: 106.
